entries.content_excerpt:
Pigmentation

Our skin is exposed to a number of different stresses that not only result in wrinkled and tired-looking skin, but also in pigmentation disorders.

The most common types of pigmentation include hyperpigmentation and hypopigmentation.

Hyperpigmentation, and post-inflammatory hyperpigmentation (HPI), are caused when an excess of melanin is produced in the skin. Excess melanin is responsible for the darkened patches that appear on the skin’s surface, creating an uneven skin tone.

Hypopigmentation, is the absence of the required levels of melanin in the skin. This means that instead of darker patches on the skin, you start to see lighter skin blotches.

Skin pigmentation may occur for various reasons and may be related to ageing, sun exposure, hormones and pregnancy. The formation of pigmentation on a cellular, microscopic level is complex and involves a number of processes. …

_Lip augmentation is one of the most requested cosmetic treatments. Men and women in Monroe, Alexandria, Shreveport, the Ark-La-Miss, Southlake, TX and the surrounding areas of Northeast Louisiana, are looking for ways to enhance their lips while maintaining a natural appearance. Dr. Janine Hopkins, M.D., F.A.A.D., board-certified dermatologist, offers lip augmentation with LipLase, a non-invasive treatment that gradually plumps the lips._

entries.content_excerpt:
What Should I Expect from Microcannula Injections?

Dr. Hopkins uses a 30-gauge, blunt-tipped microcannula to deposit dermal fillers under the skin, especially for the delicate eyelid trough and lip. Hand rejuvenation with Radiesse® is administered with a 27-gauge microcannula. The technique is preferred over needles in some cases, such as for treating the lower eyelids and lips. The skin is cleansed and numbed. A needle is used to make a tiny hole in the skin. Next, the microcannula is slipped under the skin and gently pulled along the tissue to deposit the filler. The technique is safe and causes less tissue trauma compared to needle administration.

Be Healthy, Be Beautiful. Contact Hopkins Dermatology Today.

entries.content_excerpt:
Fraxel Skin Resurfacing in Guernsey

Fraxel is nothing like the laser facial-resurfacing treatments of yesteryear, which required three to four weeks of downtime hiding from your friends.

Fraxel works by causing controlled micro-injury to the skin, and the magic happens during the repair process. Instead of completely destroying the surface of the skin, what occurs with Fraxel is a pixilated-type destruction creating tiny micro-thermal zones. Those areas then stimulate new collagen production. Fraxel targets fine lines and enlarged pores, and can address some pigmentation issues, though there are lasers that are better at eradicating more stubborn dark spots.

Penetrating deep into the dermis, the micro thermal zones eliminate old, pigmented epidermal (surface) cells, creating a controlled trauma to the skin. This triggers the body’s natural healing processes, improving the overall tone…

entries.content_excerpt:
Is There Any Downtime After Microneedling with PRP?

Patients may experience some redness, swelling, and sensitivity after microneedling with PRP, which typically subsides within a few days. Patients should avoid applying makeup or other topical products to the treated area for at least 24 hours. Otherwise, patients will be able to return to their normal activities immediately after their PRP microneedling treatments.

What Results Can I Expect from Microneedling with PRP?

Results from PRP microneedling will start becoming visible within a few days to a week after the procedure. However, optimal results typically require a series of treatments spaced several weeks apart. Over time, patients will begin to see a reduction in fine lines and wrinkles, a more even skin tone, and improved skin texture and elasticity. We may recommend a series of 3 to 6 treatments administered at monthly inter…

entries.content_excerpt:
_Certain types of acne can leave behind indentations in the skin. These types of scars may become more prominent as you get older. Dr. Janine Hopkins, M.D., F.A.A.D., board-certified dermatologist, offers treatment for acne scars for men and women in Monroe, Alexandria, Shreveport, the Ark-La-Miss, Southlake, TX and the surrounding areas of Northeast Louisiana._

What Are Acne Scars?

Some types of acne become inflamed, such as cysts, papules and pustules. Once the inflammation subsides, the healing process may result in a small scar. The scars may not be problematic at first, but unfortunately as you lose collagen with age, the scars may become more visible. Fortunately, the scars can be treated to make them less noticeable.

entries.content_excerpt:
_Sun exposure can cause many types of damage to your skin, such as actinic keratosis. Also known as solar keratosis, it is considered a precursor to skin cancer. Dr. Janine Hopkins, M.D., F.A.A.D., board-certified dermatologist, offers actinic keratosis treatments for men and women in Monroe, Alexandria, Shreveport, the Ark-La-Miss, Southlake, TX and the surrounding areas of Northeast Louisiana._

What is Actinic Keratosis?

Actinic keratosis is a condition that typically develops before skin cancer emerges. It is caused by exposure to ultraviolet light, such as what you experience from sunlight. Without treatment, actinic keratosis becomes skin cancer.

_You may be familiar with birthmarks that appear as discolored skin, but there are several types of birthmarks. For the most part, birthmarks are harmless, but some do require treatment. As a board-certified dermatologist, Dr. Janine Hopkins, M.D., F.A.A.D. offers birthmark removal for men and women in Monroe, Alexandria, Shreveport, the Ark-La-Miss, Southlake, TX and the surrounding areas of Northeast Louisiana._

What is a Birthmark?

A birthmark is a discoloration of the skin that is caused by pigmentation or the blood vessels in the skin. These marks develop before birth and are permanent. People who do have birthmarks may feel comfortable with the discoloration, but many people have birthmarks in areas that cause complications or aesthetic concerns.

What is Jeuveau®?

Jeuveau® is an injectable neurotoxin treatment that is specifically designed for cosmetic use. As a neurotoxin, the Jeuveau® formula works by relaxing the facial muscles that are responsible for creating and exaggerating facial wrinkles. By temporarily relaxing these muscles, the appearance of wrinkles fades, leaving patients with a more youthful appearance. Specifically, Jeuveau® is designed to treat glabellar lines, or frown lines, which are the wrinkles that develop between the eyes.

entries.content_excerpt:
What Should I Expect from Melanoma Treatment?

Because melanoma spreads quickly to other areas of the body, treatment involves removing the cancerous tissues. This is typically accomplished by excising the cancer with a clean margin. The margin includes a specific amount of healthy tissue. This ensures that all cancer cells are removed, including those that may not be detectable by visual inspection. The tissue is sent to a lab for evaluation and to verify that the margin is clean. If the melanoma has spread, Dr. Hopkins may refer you to an oncologist for additional treatment.

Be Healthy, Be Beautiful. Contact Hopkins Dermatology Today.

_Melanoma is the most life-threatening type of skin cancer, but there is help for the condition. Dr. Janine Hopkins, M.D., F.A.A.D., board-certified dermatologist, offers melanoma treatments for men and women in Monroe, Alexandria, Shreveport, the Ark-L…

entries.content_excerpt:
_Moles are common growths that develop on the skin. Some moles may indicate other problems, emphasizing the importance of having your moles evaluated and possibly removed. Dr. Janine Hopkins, M.D., F.A.A.D., _board-certified _ dermatologist, offers mole removal and examinations for men and women in Monroe, Alexandria, Shreveport, the Ark-La-Miss, Southlake, TX and the surrounding areas of Northeast Louisiana._

What Are Moles?

Moles develop when your body produces skin cells in an irregular growth pattern, rather than evenly across the skin. These particular cells are responsible for the color of your skin. Dr. Hopkins offers mole removal and examinations to help people understand the nature of the moles and make an informed decision about treatment.

entries.content_excerpt:
Patient Rights 
 
Right to Receive Treatment 
Patients have the right to receive healthcare services to protect and promote their health without discrimination based on gender, age, religion, status, nationality, language, race, or physical, mental, or economic circumstances. Medical professionals must not refuse treatment without a valid reason. 
 
Right to Information and Self-Determination 
Patients have the right to receive sufficient explanations from medical professionals about their areas of expertise, the patient’s medical condition, treatment goals, plans, methods, expected outcomes, potential side effects, discharge plans, medical costs, participation in medical research, and organ donation or transplantation. Patients can ask detailed questions and make informed decisions about their care. Within ethical boundaries, patients may discontinue or refuse specific treatments or pla…

entries.content_excerpt:
_Scars serve an important purpose — to quickly close a wound and prevent infection. Unfortunately, this part of the body’s healing process leaves a mark that stands out from the surrounding skin. Dr. Janine Hopkins, M.D., F.A.A.D., _board-certified _ dermatologist, offers scar revision for men and women in Monroe, Alexandria, Shreveport, the Ark-La-Miss, Southlake, TX and the surrounding areas of Northeast Louisiana._

What is Scar Revision?

The reason that scars are easily detected is that collagen fibers were quickly produced to close a wound. Collagen fibers are an important part of your skin, and when collagen production operates at a normal rate, the fibers develop in a structured pattern. In the case of a wound, though, the fibers develop quickly and without any clear pattern. Therefore, your scar has a different color and texture than the surrounding skin. Scar revision helps to …

entries.content_excerpt:
_The human papillomavirus, or HPV, may cause abnormal growths on the skin known as “warts.” Warts are mostly harmless, but they can be spread to other people, so you may want to consider having the wart removed. Dr. Janine Hopkins, M.D., F.A.A.D., board-certified dermatologist, offers wart removal for men and women in Monroe, Alexandria, Shreveport, the Ark-La-Miss, Southlake, TX and the surrounding areas of Northeast Louisiana._

What Are Warts?

Human papillomavirus, or HPV, has emerged as a popular topic in the media. What many people do not know, however, is that some types of HPV cause warts. The virus triggers an accelerated development of cells in the skin, and while people typically have warts on their hands and fingers, these growths can develop anywhere. Warts may be contagious, but they are also a cosmetic concern for men and women.

entries.content_excerpt:
What is INTRACEL MICRONEEDLING?

\- The INTRAcel™ technology combines micro-needling to penetrate the skin and uses radio frequency to deliver heat energy deep into the skin tissue. 

\- The layers of the skin respond to the thousands of tiny microscopic energy points by generating new collagen growth which encourages the skin to tighten and heal naturally. The effect is similar to peeling, but with minimal impact. This results in thicker, firmer skin rejuvenation. 

\- For acne and acne scarring, INTRAcel™ uses radio frequency energy to reduce the production of sebum and bacteria. The RF energy helps promote the production of elastin and collagen which minimize the appearance of acne scarring. 

What can INTRAcel™ be used for??

entries.content_excerpt:
Smartxide CO2 Laser Resurfacing in Guernsey

The SmartXIDE Dot fractional laser resurfacing device, available at the Aesthetic Skin Clinic, offers a powerful laser system capable of significant skin resurfacing while avoiding the heavy downtime associated with other ablative resurfacing treatments, and cosmetic surgery.

The fractional delivery of energy means that downtime is reduced dramatically, as it selectively protects parts of the epidermis from trauma, which in previous technologies created a longer healing process. By altering the depth of the treatment, we can tailor the treatment around each case and every skin type, meaning Co2 is suitable for a wider range of patients and indications.

The SmartXIDE works by coagulating and removing columns of skin, encouraging new, healthier skin to surface. Within treatment, collagen is also stimulated, leading to tighter and firmer skin f…

How Much Does Cryosurgery Cost in Monroe, LA and Southlake, TX?

We understand that cost is a consideration for your medical dermatology treatments, and we wish to provide the most accurate information as possible. Cryosurgery is tailored to the patient, so the cost does vary. We can provide the most accurate pricing at the time of your appointment with Dr. Hopkins.

What Are the Benefits of Cryosurgery?

Cryosurgery is often the last option for safely and effectively removing skin cancer and abnormal growths. Compared to other methods, cryosurgery is less invasive, and patients heal from the procedure more quickly.

How Do I Know If I Need Cryosurgery?

If you have a skin growth or cancer, Dr. Hopkins will begin treatment with the most conservative treatment possible. When other options fail to produce the desired result, cryosurgery is used to treat the area.

entries.content_excerpt:
How Does Emerald Laser™ Work?

Emerald Laser™ works by emitting low-level green laser energy that targets and emulsifies fat cells beneath the skin. This advanced technology creates temporary pores in the fat cells, allowing the stored fat to be released and naturally processed by the body’s lymphatic system. This results in a slimmer, more contoured appearance without the need for surgery or downtime.

What is the Emerald Laser™ Treatment Like?

During the Emerald Laser™ treatment, the laser is applied externally to the target area. The procedure is completely unattended, meaning it does not require constant supervision by a technician, enhancing convenience and comfort for patients. The low-level laser energy penetrates the skin and targets the fat cells without affecting the surrounding tissues. This makes the treatment safe and pain-free. The laser energy creates temporary pores in t…

entries.content_excerpt:
\- Mesotherapy, which is the injection of substances locally into mesodermally derived subcutaneous tissue, developed from empirical observations of a French physician in the 1950s. Although popular in Europe for many medical purposes, it is used for local cosmetic fat reduction in the United States.

\- Aminophylline is a mixture of theophylline and ethylenediamine. It is a common asthma medication and has a mode of action and efficacy similar to that of caffeine. In mesotherapy, it is used to promote the breakdown of fat and induce vasodilation. Aminophylline effectively inhibits phosphodiesterase, thereby increasing cAMP concentration, which allows for more efficient breakdown of fat in the cell.

\- Aminophylline has a narrow therapeutic index. Adverse reactions can be encountered at dosages of around 250mg in most individuals. Side effects include nausea, vomiting and diarrhea. Card…

What is Kybella®?

Kybella® is an FDA-approved injectable treatment designed to reduce fat cells in specific areas of the body. This non-surgical procedure involves the administration of deoxycholic acid, a naturally occurring molecule in the body that aids in the breakdown and absorption of dietary fat. Kybella® is particularly effective for those hard-to-shift pockets of fat that resist diet and exercise.

Benefits of Kybella®

Permanent Results: Once the fat cells are destroyed, they are gone for good, meaning Kybella® provides permanent results.

entries.content_excerpt:
How Do I Know If I Need Photodynamic Therapy (PDT)?

Photodynamic therapy is recommended for some types of cancer. The technique is widely used and Dr. Hopkins has been using this in both practices for over 20 years to treat pre-cancers with excellent results and minimum to no complications.

What Should I Expect from Photodynamic Therapy (PDT)?

After the photosensitizing medications are administered topically, the pre-cancer cells absorb the medications. A special high-intensity light is applied to the treatment area to kill the cells. The procedure may also damage blood vessels that feed the pre-cancer cells. Your immune system takes over and continues to kill the pre-cancer. Dr. Hopkins monitors your progress to ensure that the pre-cancer does not return and that you do not develop new lesions in the surrounding tissues.

Be Healthy, Be Beautiful. Contact Hopkins Dermatology Today.

No upsells, extra charges, or hidden fees. We believe in clear and competitive pricing for our treatments, with no hidden costs. All pricing details will be clearly explained during your consultation.

What is Sculptra®?

Sculptra is an FDA-approved injectable treatment formulated with poly-L-lactic acid (PLLA), a biocompatible substance that stimulates your body’s natural collagen production. Unlike traditional dermal fillers, which provide immediate results by adding volume, Sculptra works gradually to rebuild collagen, leading to long-lasting and natural-looking enhancements.

How Does Sculptra Work?

**Collagen Stimulation** :Sculptra is injected into the deep layers of the skin, where it starts to stimulate the production of new collagen fibers. This process helps to restore lost volume and improve skin firmness over time.

What is Skin Cancer Surgery?

Skin cancer surgery is the most common technique that is used to remove cancerous cells. Once the diagnosis is complete Dr. Hopkins discusses your surgery options. The three popular techniques are Mohs surgery, [cryosurgery](https://www.hopkinsdermatology.com/cryosurgery-monroe/), and excision.

What is Ultherapy?

Ultherapy is a safe, non-surgical ultrasound treatment that counteracts the effects of time and gravity on your skin. Ultherapy uses the body's own regenerative response to gently and gradually lift skin on the eyebrow, under the chin and on the neck, and smooth lines and wrinkles on the décolletage. ​​ 

Can Ultherapy replace a face lift?

Ultherapy treats the deep foundational layer addressed in cosmetic surgery, but won't duplicate the results of a facelift. Ultherapy is a great alternative, however, especially for those not ready for surgery or for patients looking to extend the effects of cosmetic surgery.
